user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of print_perf_warnings:
```c
static void
print_perf_warnings (void)
{
  int newline_needed = 0;
#if defined (_DEBUG)
  fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: Running with debug asserts enabled, "
           "the performance is suboptimal.\n");
  newline_needed |=  ! 0;
#endif /* _DEBUG */
#if defined(__GNUC__) && ! defined (__OPTIMIZE__)
  fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The tools is compiled without enabled compiler "
           "optimisations, the performance is suboptimal.\n");
  newline_needed |=  ! 0;
#endif /* __GNUC__ && ! __OPTIMIZE__ */
#if defined(__GNUC__) && defined (__OPTIMIZE_SIZE__)
  fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The tools is compiled with size-optimisations, "
           "the performance is suboptimal.\n");
#endif /* __GNUC__ && ! __OPTIMIZE__ */
#if MHD_VERSION >= 0x00097701
  if (MHD_NO != MHD_is_feature_supported (MHD_FEATURE_DEBUG_BUILD))
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The libmicrohttpd is compiled with "
             "debug asserts enabled, the performance is suboptimal.\n");
    newline_needed |=  ! 0;
  }
#endif /* MHD_VERSION >= 0x00097701 */
  if (newline_needed)
    printf ("\n");
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Other code in the function does not create (or directly affect) controlling expressions that can be invariant for the purposes of MISRA C: the fprintf calls are simple I/O statements and not selection/iteration controlling expressions; the local declaration and initialization int newline_needed = 0; by itself is not a controlling expression (it simply initializes state); the preprocessor #if / #endif blocks control compilation but are compile-time directives rather than C selection/iteration statements covered by Rule 14.3 in the source code — their presence only matters insofar as they may cause the listed C if-statements/assignments to produce an invariant runtime controlling expression (those cases are already reported). No other if/for/while/do-while/switch controlling expressions appear in the provided function.
